resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
nealrichardson commented on pull request #4900: ARROW-5963: [R] R Appveyor job does not test changes in the C++ library
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4900
 
 
   This changes the PKGBUILD script to use the local checkout to build the C++ library.

nealrichardson commented on issue #4900: ARROW-5963: [R] R Appveyor job does not test changes in the C++ library
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4900#issuecomment-512591887
 
 
   It's not a name of my choosing, it's what they're called everywhere: https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/PKGBUILD
   
   cf. https://github.com/msys2/MINGW-packages
   
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on issue #4900: ARROW-5963: [R] R Appveyor job does not test changes in the C++ library
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4900#issuecomment-512592975
 
 
   Right, but you copy it here
   
   https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/ci/appveyor-build-r.sh#L42
   
   so you could call it `PKGBUILD_MINGW` or something to people understand what it is by the name
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
It seems like master is being used 

https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/ci/PKGBUILD#L42

I observed this in 

https://ci.appveyor.com/project/wesm/arrow/builds/26030853/job/7vn8q3l8e24t83jh?fullLog=true

from this PR

https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4841 for ARROW-5893
fields.summary: [R] R Appveyor job does not test changes in the C++ library
